verses.kjv: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one’s birth.
verses.ct: A good reputation is worth more than expensive perfume, and the day you die is more significant than the day you were born.

verses.kjv: It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.
verses.ct: It's better to attend a funeral than to attend a party, because death is the destiny of every person, and the living should take this to heart.

verses.kjv: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.
verses.ct: Grief is better than laughter, because when the face is sad, the heart grows wiser.

verses.kjv: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.
verses.ct: Wise people think about death, but fools occupy themselves with entertainment.

verses.kjv: It is better to hear the rebuke of the wise, than for a man to hear the song of fools.
verses.ct: It's better to listen to a wise person's correction than to listen to the songs of fools.

verses.kjv: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.
verses.ct: The laughter of fools is like the popping of thorns burning under a pot — it's loud but meaningless. This too is pointless.

verses.kjv: Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
verses.ct: Oppression can drive a wise person crazy, and a bribe corrupts the heart.

verses.kjv: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
verses.ct: The finish of something is better than its start, and patience is better than pride.

verses.kjv: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
verses.ct: Don't be quick to get angry, because anger finds a home in the hearts of fools.

verses.kjv: Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not enquire wisely concerning this.
verses.ct: Don't ask, 'Why were the old days better than now?' That's not a wise question to ask.

verses.kjv: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
verses.ct: Wisdom paired with an inheritance is a good thing, and it benefits everyone who lives under the sun.

verses.kjv: For wisdom is a defence, and money is a defence: but the excellency of knowledge is, that wisdom giveth life to them that have it.
verses.ct: Wisdom provides protection, just as money provides protection, but the advantage of knowledge is this: wisdom preserves the life of those who have it.

verses.kjv: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?
verses.ct: Think about what God has done — who can straighten what he has made crooked?

verses.kjv: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.
verses.ct: When times are good, enjoy them. When times are hard, reflect on this: God has arranged both situations so that no one can predict what the future holds.

verses.kjv: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongeth his life in his wickedness.
verses.ct: During my fleeting life I've seen it all: a righteous person dying despite their righteousness, and a wicked person living a long life despite their wickedness.

verses.kjv: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself ?
verses.ct: Don't be excessively righteous, and don't try to be overly wise — why would you ruin yourself?

verses.kjv: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?
verses.ct: Don't be excessively wicked, and don't be foolish — why would you die before your time?

verses.kjv: It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.
verses.ct: It's good to hold on to the one without letting go of the other, because whoever deeply reveres God will navigate through both extremes.

verses.kjv: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.
verses.ct: Wisdom gives a wise person more strength than 10 powerful leaders in a city.

verses.kjv: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.
verses.ct: There is no one on earth so righteous that they always do good and never sin.

verses.kjv: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:
verses.ct: Don't pay attention to everything people say, or you might hear your own servant speaking against you.

verses.kjv: For oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others.
verses.ct: After all, you know in your own heart that many times you yourself have spoken against others.

verses.kjv: All this have I proved by wisdom: I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.
verses.ct: I tested all of this through wisdom. I told myself, 'I will become wise,' but it remained beyond my reach.

verses.kjv: That which is far off, and exceeding deep, who can find it out?
verses.ct: Whatever exists is distant and profoundly deep — who can discover it?

verses.kjv: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:
verses.ct: I devoted myself to understanding, investigating, and searching out wisdom and the logic behind things, and to recognizing that wickedness is foolishness and that foolishness is madness.

verses.kjv: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.
verses.ct: I discovered something more bitter than death: the woman whose heart is full of traps and nets, and whose hands are like chains. Whoever pleases God will escape her, but the sinner will be captured by her.

verses.kjv: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:
verses.ct: "Look, this is what I found," says the Teacher, "adding one thing to another to reach a conclusion —

verses.kjv: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.
verses.ct: something my soul has searched for continually but never found: I found 1 upright man among 1,000, but not a single upright woman among all of them.

verses.kjv: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.
verses.ct: Here is the one thing I did discover: God made human beings to be straightforward, but they have pursued endless complications.
